notes: 10 business days for initial response. Each agency must designate Records Access Officer (RAO). Appeals to Supervisor of Records. Enhanced law effective January 1, 2017.

basic_request.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Request
basic_request.body:
Dear Records Access Officer:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, M.G.L. c. 66, ยง 10, I respectfully request access to inspect and copy the following public records:

[SPECIFIC DESCRIPTION OF RECORDS]

Please provide a written response within 10 business days as required by law. If you cannot provide the records within this timeframe, please provide a written explanation and fee estimate.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a detailed basis for withholding the materials, including specific statutory or common law exemptions and explanations of why they apply.

I prefer to receive responsive records electronically when possible to minimize costs. Please contact me if clarification is needed.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
[YOUR NAME]
[YOUR ADDRESS]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]

appeal_template.subject: Appeal to Supervisor of Records - Public Records Request Denial
appeal_template.body:
Dear Supervisor of Records:

I am appealing the denial of my Massachusetts Public Records Law request dated [DATE]. On [DATE], [AGENCY] denied my request for [DESCRIPTION OF RECORDS] citing [REASON FOR DENIAL].

I believe this denial is improper under M.G.L. c. 66, ยง 10 because [LEGAL REASONING]. The requested records appear to be public records that should be disclosed under Massachusetts law.

I request that you review this denial and order the agency to provide the requested records. Attached are copies of my original request and the agency's denial.

Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,
[YOUR NAME]
[YOUR ADDRESS]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]
